sections.title: Purpose
sections.content: This contract outlines the terms and conditions under which the City Council approves the issuance of bonds for stormwater management projects, aimed at improving drainage, reducing flooding, and enhancing water quality within the city.

sections.title: Scope
sections.content: The bond proceeds will be utilized exclusively for the design, construction, and maintenance of stormwater infrastructure, including but not limited to retention basins, drainage systems, and water treatment facilities. The projects funded by this bond will address areas identified as high-risk for flooding and stormwater runoff.

sections.title: Terms
sections.content: The total amount of bonds approved is M dollars, with an interest rate not to exceed 5%. The bonds will be repaid over a period of 20 years through a combination of property taxes and fees collected from the stormwater utility. The City Council commits to providing annual reports on the progress of the projects funded by this bond and ensuring compliance with all applicable environmental regulations.

input.headline: City Council approves M stormwater bond

suggestions: Consider specifying the anticipated outcomes or metrics for success related to the stormwater management projects to provide clarity on the objectives.
Add a clause regarding stakeholder engagement or community input in the planning and execution of stormwater projects to ensure public transparency and accountability.
Specify the conditions under which the interest rate may change or if there are penalties for late repayment to avoid ambiguity.
Include a provision for what happens in the event of a shortfall in property tax or utility fee collections to outline potential financial risks.

issues: Lack of specific details regarding the financial management of bond proceeds and accountability measures.
No mention of mitigation strategies if projects do not meet outlined goals or if there are delays.
